page.title: 02THE CARNIVAL FLOAT BY K.R.
page.content: Every Whit Monday we have a carnival. It is custom that we all meet the night before and decorate the float. On the way to the meeting the girls pick wild flowers in the castle grounds and the ladies pick branches.Sometimes we have a lorry to dress but usually it is a tractor and trailor. We put a farm gate on the trailor and secured it down.The theme of the float this year was "The Whole Damn Family" There was hay strewn all over the trailor and logs to sit on. The morning of the Carnival we meet at Scurtle Farm all dressed in our costumes and then we make our way to Clarbeston Road where the Carnival is held.We join up with the other villages and follow the procession which leads to the judging of the floats.Ice-creams all round at the end
